messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node replace in the Stable Video Diffusion model?
The ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid node replaces the init_image conditioning in the Stable Video Diffusion image to video model with text embeds and a conditioning frame.
What is the recommended input state for the latents in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
It is recommended to input the latents in a noisy state when using ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid.
Does default ComfyUI noise create optimal results for ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
No, default ComfyUI noise does not create optimal results for ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid. Using other noise like Power-Law Noise is recommended.
What inputs are preserved for the conditioning frame in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
Motion bucket, fps, and augmentation level are preserved as possible inputs for the conditioning frame in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid.
How long does it take for the video generation to stabilize in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
The video generation in ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid needs a couple of frames time to get on its feet and run.
How can you get more color into the generated video using ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
Maxing out EDM sigma and using additional prompts like 'realistic' can help get more color into the generated video when using ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid.
What helps with image quality consistency when using ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid?
Keeping a small CFG guidance spread of around 2 using VideoLinearCFGGuidance helps with image quality consistency when using ComfyUI-svd_txt2vid.
